_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The two fools and the two who are astute: One who doesn’t recognize when they’ve made a mistake
One who doesn’t properly accept the confession of someone who’s made a mistake
One who recognizes when they’ve made a mistake
One who properly accepts the confession of someone who’s made a mistake
The two who misrepresent the Realized On: One who is hateful and hides it, and one whose faith is mistaken
One who explains what was not spoken by the Realized One as spoken by him, and one who explains what was spoken by the Realized One as not spoken by him
One who explains what was not spoken by the Realized One as not spoken by him, and one who explains what was spoken by the Realized One as spoken by him
One who explains a discourse in need of interpretation as a discourse in need of interpretation, and one who explains a discourse whose meaning is explicit as a discourse whose meaning is explicit
The two destinies of hiding and not hidi: As a god or a human
The two destinies of having wrong and ri: As a god or a human
The two places waiting to receive an une: The realms of gods and humans
The two reasons to frequent remote lodgi: Seeing a happy life for oneself in the present
